Summary Applications Developer, Database Administrator, limited Project Management experience in resource management applications. Particularly interested in Computer Security, and developing software solutions with a multitude of front ends using SOAP/web service technologies. I want to write software applications that will delight customers and impact people's lives. Integrated data warehouse system with SAP delivery tracking system to allow users to see the complete life cycle of their request. 
Written in HTML, jQuery, and jQuery Mobile. 
•	Rebranded an internal business indicator website by using HFE and UX techniques, so business saw increase in visibility and user base. 
•	Comparative analysis and proof of concepted with Silverlight, Adobe Air, and HTML5 technologies led to decision to replatform to HTML5. Undergrad Intern Technical Intel Corporation June 2010  –  September 2010  (4 months) Folsom, CA Automate the batch configuration process in Perl. For this project, Quality is a must­a bug could 
destabilize the environment for the Intel Business Groups. Customer Oriented and Results Oriented is 
also a must­Batch administrators must deliver a competitive and useful product. 
Developed a program for employees to assign work tasks for contract workers, in Perl. 
Developed an audit program for UNIX CFEngine package distribution in Perl. 
Developed a program for Service Desk to handle E-mail to ticket conversions in Perl. Undergrad Intern Technical Intel Corporation June 2009  –  September 2009  (4 months) Folsom, CA Developed 3 reporting tools, using HTML, JavaScript, and Big Fix's Relevance Language, to 
measure progress of patching compliance across 170,000 laptops and servers. Reports also 
allows admins to diagnose noncompliant computers by querying computer properties. Undergrad Intern Technical Intel Corporation June 2008  –  September 2008  (4 months) Folsom, CA Developed a metric indicator to measure average run time and average wait time for batch 
jobs. People used a Windows Web Application (written in C#), while the back-end used a 
SQL database, and an UNIX data collector (written in PERL). The app granulates 80,000 
daily data points into 500MB (or two years) of data, providing weekly, daily, and hourly views. Undergrad Intern Technical Intel Corporation June 2007  –  September 2007  (4 months) Folsom, CA Developed an application (under PLC) to diagnose UNIX Log-in problems for end users. 
Project included a Windows Web Service (SOAP), a Windows Web Application, a Windows 
Application, and a UNIX daemon written in C#, and PERL. Deployed to 20,000 workstations. Mentored & trained software development staff. Trouble shot problem areas in development process and provided Flex expertise. Wrote foreign language learning activities using Adobe Flex 3.x. Heavy use of avatars (FLVs), graphics, & audio creating a true multi-media experience. XML content files used to switch among different foreign languages using the same activity (written in Flex).
